alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:03AM EDT until April 20 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain will fall increasing runoff into rivers that will increase flows which will reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Peter Nordeen park on right bank floods * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:55 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:55 AM EDT Sunday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 3.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 04/21/1985. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM CDT /1000 PM EDT/.
